description: Fixed some bass dynamics and timing. Rest is the same
title: Alison Hell

description:
Reverted to the old tab with proper guitar intro, because there is quite obviously no piano in this song, as well as minor additions and changes:
- Fixed the distortion guitar intro (the A to D# bit). Playing it as low 5/higher 6 is correct and certainly more practical, but I changed it because this is the way Waters actually plays it (as seen in the official video).
- Added a slide to the pre-chorus high part. Probably sounds like shit on Songsterr, but there is very clearly a slide in the original song. 
Things to work on next include:
- Adding vocals
- Fixing dynamics
- Minor tempo errors
title: Alison Hell

description:
- Correctly named all the tracks
- Added a separate lead and clean guitar track
- Made changes to bass parts throughout the song as according to Jeff Waters instructional video
- Made changes to plenty of riffs to better fit the record 
- Significantly rewrote ALL of the drum track fit the record and spaced it out for readability
- Made minor tempo changes
- Added markers throughout the song and named the song structure
*Have not added the harmony on bars 113-115*
title: Alison Hell
